generif.text: links neurofibromin and merlin in a common cellular pathway of neurofibromatosis

With residues 814-963 of human ubiquitous kinesin heavy chain (uKHC) used as bait, a synaptosome-associated protein of 25 kDa (SNAP25) has been identified as a kinesin-binding protein in a human brain cDNA library.
Results identify the ribosome receptor, p180, as a binding partner of the kinesin heavy chain isoform KIF5B.

Demonstrates the utility of screening for PDGFRA kinase domain overexpression in patients with IHES and has identified KIF5B as a third PDGFRA fusion partner in chronic myeloproliferative disorders.

We demonstrate that KIF5B mediates post-Golgi transport of an apical protein in epithelial cells, but only after polarity has developed.

Data suggest that the promotion of lamellipodia formation by HGF in MDA-MB-231 cells is Rac1-dependent and requires KIF5B-mediated transport of WAVE2 and IQGAP1 to the cell periphery along microtubules.

The interaction of the Switch I region of the kinesin-1 head with the tail is strikingly similar to the interactions of small GTPases with their regulators, indicating that other kinesin motors may share similar regulatory mechanisms.

training-induced changes in submaximal exercise stroke volume may be due to mitochondrial function and variation in KIF5B expression as determined by functional SNPs in its promoter.

RANBP2 is the first native and positive allosteric activator known to jump-start and boost directly the activity of KIF5B.

This indicates that kinesin-1 facilitates the transport of SNAP-25 containing vesicles as a prerequisite to SNAP-25 driven membrane fusion events.

The conventional kinesin-microtubule binding free energy is dominated by van der Waals interactions and electrostatic interactions.

findings show a bipartite tryptophan-based motif in vaccinia virus A36 is required for kinesin-1-dependent transport of the virus; bioinformatic analysis reveals that related bipartite tryptophan-based motifs are present in over 450 human proteins
Kinesin-1-mediated capsid disassembly and disruption of the nuclear pore complex promote virus infection.

Arl8 and SKIP are required for lysosomes to distribute away from the microtubule-organizing center. We identify two kinesin light chain binding motifs in SKIP that are required for lysosomes to accumulate kinesin-1 and redistribute to the cell periphery.

Patients without KIF5B-RET fusions had a better prognosis than those with KIF5B-RET fusions (median survival, 52.6 months vs 21.0 months).

Anti-oncogenic miR-203 had a pivotal role in melanoma through reducing melanosome transport and promoting melanogenesis by targeting kif5b and through negative regulation of the CREB1/MITF/Rab27a pathway.
when cargo is transported by both dynein and phosphorylated kinesin, a common occurrence in the cell, there may be a bias that favors motion toward the minus-end of microtubules.
Kinesin-1 transports c-MYC for proteasomal degradation in the cytoplasm.

Our data suggest that KIF5B-RET promotes the cell growth and tumorigenicity of non-small cell lung cancers through multilevel activation of STAT3 signaling, providing possible strategies for the treatment of KIF5B-RET positive lung cancers.

nesprin-dependent recruitment of kinesin-1 to the nuclear envelope through the interaction of a conserved LEWD motif with kinesin light chain might be a general mechanism for cell-type-specific nuclear positioning during development.
This study has provided a comprehensive structural and dynamic picture of kinesin's major ATPase states.

Myo1c significantly increases the frequency of kinesin-1-driven microtubule-based runs that begin at actin/microtubule intersections. The actin-binding protein tropomyosin 2 abolishes Myo1c-specific effects on both run initiation and run termination.
In this work, we performed normal mode analysis with elastic network model using different conformation of kinesin to determine the effect of tail binding.
the front head of a kinesin dimer is gated by the backward orientation of its neck linker until the rear head releases from the microtubule
Kinesin-1 is primarily front-head gated, and its neck linker length is tuned to enhance unidirectional processivity and velocity.

In contrast, P75NTR binding to Kif5B is enhanced by tyrosine phosphorylation and thus has the potential to be dynamically regulated on a more rapid time scale

Utilizing novel electron cryomicroscopy methods, the authors solved structures of microtubule-attached, dimeric kinesin bound to an ATP analog. They find that under these conditions, the kinesin dimer can attach to the microtubule with either one or two motor domains.
In particular, counteracting forces between minus-end-directed kinesin-14 and plus-end-directed kinesin-5 motors have recently been implicated in the regulation of microtubule nucleation.

Study demonstrate that the kinesin and kinase domains of KIF5B-RET act together to establish an emergent microtubule and RAB-vesicle-dependent RET-SRC-EGFR-FGFR signaling hub. Study demonstrate that drugs designed to inhibit RET alone work poorly in KIF5B-RET-transformed cells.
KIF5B gene rearrangement plays a role in the pathogenesis of papillary thyroid cancer.
HIV-1 did not stimulate widespread FEZ1 phosphorylation but, instead, bound microtubule (MT) affinity-regulating kinase 2 (MARK2) to stimulate FEZ1 phosphorylation on viral cores.

the discovery of kinesore, a small molecule that in vitro inhibits kinesin-1 interactions with short linear peptide motifs found in organelle-specific cargo adaptors, yet activates kinesin-1's function of controlling microtubule dynamics in cells, demonstrating that these functions are mechanistically coupled.
these studies demonstrate that kinesin 1 regulates ciliogenesis through CCDC28B
The KIF5B-MET variant was demonstrated to have an oncogenic function in cancer cells.

High KIF5B expression in oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC) tissue specimens was significantly associated with tumor size, histological differentiation, disease recurrence, surrounding tissue invasion, recurrence time, and survival status. Kaplan-Meier cumulative survival analyses indicated that high expression of KIF5B was linked to worse overall survival and disease-free survival in OSCC.

X-ray fiber diffraction, fluorescence speckle microscopy, and second-harmonic generation microscopy, as well as cryo-EM, collectively demonstrated that the binding of nucleotide-free kinesin-1 to GDP microtubules changes the conformation of the GDP microtubule to a conformation resembling the GTP microtubule.
Report ALK-positive histiocytosis with frequent presence of KIF5B-ALK gene fusion.

this is the first report of a KIF5B-ALK fusion gene in large-cell neuroendocrine carcinoma (LCNEC) . The patient was successfully treated with ALK inhibitors, suggesting that sensitivity to ALK inhibitor may define a specific LCNEC subtype. We propose that screening for ALK rearrangement in patients with LCNEC may assist in selecting potential candidates for targeted therapy.

TGF-beta mediated pro-invasive activity was found to be dependent on KIF5B expression. In contrast, the epithelial differentiation factor and EMT suppressor prolactin (PRL) was found to repress KIF5B gene expression and KIF5B-Snail1 nuclear accumulation, but enhanced KLC1 gene expression and KIF5B-KLC1 interaction.

Specific depletion of the motor protein KIF5B leads to deficits in dendritic transport, synaptic plasticity and memory.

Dominant negative variants in KIF5B cause osteogenesis imperfecta via down regulation of mTOR signaling.

summary: Enables identical protein binding activity; microtubule binding activity; and microtubule motor activity. Involved in several processes, including lysosome localization; natural killer cell mediated cytotoxicity; and positive regulation of protein localization to plasma membrane. Located in centriolar satellite; cytosol; and vesicle. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
